basin, bucket, water container or similar
objects for presence of water.

questionOptions.text: Pit latrine without slab / Open pit
Own toilet only shared by members of the household
Own toilet shared with 10-15 people (or less) including other households
Own toilet shared with more than 15 people including other households
Removed by service provider to a treatment plant
Emptied by household buried in a covered pit
Removed by service provider to don't know where
Removed by service provider to buried pit
Emptied by household to uncovered pit, open ground, water body or elsewhere
Toilet is not always safe for all household members to use
Limited mobility prevents members from using the toilet
Distance/barriers prevent members from reaching the toilet
Toilet is not always available to all household members
Before, during, and after preparing food
Before and after caring for someone at home who is sick with vomiting or diarrhea.
After changing diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet
Every moring and every day before bed
Disposed of within household yard or plot
Disposed of in designated waste disposal area
Disposed directly to open ground or water body
N/A (cooking, laundry and bathing is done away from the household)
Sink/drain connected to open drain or open ground
